pache.all.sort.algorithms

Class RecursiveSortMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • pache.all.sort.algorithms.RecursiveSortMethods

  • public class RecursiveSortMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with implementation of some sort algorithms like mergeSort(Collection), heapSort(Object), #quickSort(Object)
    Author:
    lpache

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static <T> java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> mergeSort(java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> list)

    • Method Detail

      • mergeSort

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> mergeSort(java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> list)
        This is a recursive implementation of merge sort that is a stable sort and use a divide an conquer algorithm. The algorithm is dived in two part:
        1 split the array until has many array of one value (Array with size one is sorted).
        2 Merge every left/right pair into a sorted array until has only one sorted array.
        Parameters:
        collection -
        Returns:
        sorted collection

      • quickSort

        public static <T> void quickSort(java.util.List<java.lang.Comparable<T>> list,
                                 int start,
                                 int end)
        This is a recursive implementation of quick sort that is a unstable sort and use a divide an conquer algorithm.
        Parameters:
        list - unsorted
        start - position index
        end - position index

      • heapSort

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<T> heapSort(T collection)
